item.title: Overview
item.description:
This page provides a comprehensive overview of Ghoti, its concepts, and its intended use cases.

What is Ghoti?

Ghoti is a fast, in-memory, centralized coordination service designed for distributed systems. Inspired by the Unix philosophy of doing one thing well, Ghoti provides a simple way to coordinate ephemeral state, rate limiting, and signaling between distributed components, without the complexity of persistent storage or heavy consensus protocols.

At its core, Ghoti offers 1000 configurable “slots”â€”think of them as lightweight registers or memory cells. Each slot can be configured for a specific behavior, such as storing a value, acting as a rate limiter, propagating signals, or serving as a counter. Clients interact with these slots using a plain text protocol over TCP or Telnet, making integration easy from any programming language.

item.title: About Ghoti
item.description:
About Ghoti

A fast, in-memory, centralized coordination service for distributed systems.

Ghoti is a simple, high-performance service that centralizes key information for distributed systems. Inspired by Unix philosophy, it provides 1000 configurable slots accessible via a plain text protocol over TCP or Telnet. Each slot can be used for memory storage, rate limiting, signaling, and more.
